title: White Glove Implementation Service Play
description: Overcome implementation concerns with premium professional services at a strategic discount

articleSections.heading: Prep
articleSections.content:
Confirm deal eligibility and get manager approval before introducing this play.
Verify Stage 3+ with $100k+ deal amount
Confirm deal is targeting close this fiscal year
Get manager approval—this is required
Review the LOE checklist for initial scoping

articleSections.heading: Discovery
articleSections.content:
Identify specific implementation concerns and map to the four pillars.
Understand their current state and technical environment
Identify which pillars address their concerns (PM, Config, Migration, Integrations)
Document specific pain points and complexity drivers

articleSections.heading: Pitch
articleSections.content:
Position White Glove as strategic accelerator, not a discount.
Frame as "accelerated value realization"
Walk through the deck focusing on relevant pillars
Emphasize this is additional work above standard package

articleSections.heading: Customize
articleSections.content:
Work with PS to scope the specific services needed.
Loop in Franklin (PS) when prospect shows interest
Use LOE checklist to estimate hours for each pillar
Customize proposal template with scoped services

articleSections.heading: Handle Objections
articleSections.content:
Address common concerns and reframe as value investment.
"We have internal resources" → Focus on time-to-value and expertise
"Can we get a bigger discount?" → This is already below standard rates
"We'll handle it ourselves" → Reference complexity and past customer experiences

articleSections.heading: Follow-Up
articleSections.content:
Finalize the proposal and add to the deal.
Send customized proposal with scoped services
Include timeline and expected outcomes
Coordinate with PS on delivery capacity

modules.title: White Glove Implementation Service Play Introduction
modules.description: This is an add-on service, not a blanket discount. Four pillars: PM, Config, Migration, Integrations. Requires manager approval—strategize first.

contentBlocks.title: Overview
contentBlocks.content:
What It Is — A strategic offering providing 30% discount on professional services work above the standard implementation package—not a blanket discount.
Who It's For — Stage 3+ deals ($100k+) closing this fiscal year where implementation concerns are a genuine blocker.
When to Use — When prospects express concerns about implementation complexity, resource constraints, or timeline. Requires manager approval before running.
Four Pillars — Project Management, Configuration, Migration, and Integrations—each can be offered separately or combined.

faqs.question: Do I need manager approval?
faqs.answer: Yes, this play requires manager approval before running. Strategize with your manager first on whether it's appropriate for your deal.

faqs.question: Can I combine this with the Buyout Program?
faqs.answer: Yes—this pairs naturally with the Buyout Program. Stack both for maximum impact when appropriate.

faqs.question: Who do I loop in for scoping?
faqs.answer: Contact Franklin (PS) when someone is interested—he'll provide guidance on initial questions or join the scoping call.

faqs.question: What's the discount structure?
faqs.answer: 30% discount applies to work ABOVE the standard implementation package—it's not a blanket discount on everything.

faqs.question: What deals qualify?
faqs.answer: Stage 3+ deals, targeting close this fiscal year, $100k+ deal amount. Implementation concerns must be a genuine blocker.
